text: Bourreria baccata is a species of plant in the family Boraginaceae. It is native to Caribbean islands including Jamaica, and also to parts of north and South America. Common names include cherry, currant tree, poisonberry, chink, and bodywood. ==References== baccata Category:Near threatened plants Category:Endemic flora of Jamaica Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Bourreria baccata
